body:
Was this at head? I've fixed a slew of similar problems recently. Not
shocked there's one more.

On Tue, Dec 8, 2015, 5:40 AM Nicolas RUFF notifications@github.com wrote:

> I compiled the whole stack (from protobuf to gRPC) with clang and
> -fsanitize=address.
> 
> examples/cpp/helloworld/greeter_server will refuse to run because of an
> ODR violation:
> 
>   [1] size=88 'grpc_client_census_filter' src/core/census/grpc_filter.c:172:27
>   [2] size=88 'grpc_client_census_filter' src/core/census/grpc_filter.c:172:27
> 
> const grpc_channel_filter grpc_client_census_filter is initialized by
> both libgrpc.so and libgrpc_unsecure.so - and greeter_server apparently
> links both.
> 
> This is not an issue per se, as both initializations are probably
> identical, but this prevents further testing with odr-violation enabled
> in ASAN (which would possibly yield more interesting results).
> 
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/4331.

Apparently it still reproduces at head:

```
$ git log | head
commit 6a18f0ce93bfc407a84b79e2769e14ac7aa24648
Merge: 045c848 82e40da
Author: jboeuf <jboeuf@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Mon Dec 7 22:47:01 2015 -0800
    Merge pull request #4326 from ctiller/creds-test-fix
    Fix memory leak
...
```

Just apply the following changes to `helloworld` `Makefile`:

```
CXX = clang++
LDFLAGS += -fsanitize-address
```
